thesis.description: The main purpose of this research is to study, explore and make a critical evaluation of the existing housing situation, housing programmes and planning in Hong Kong, with particular reference to the lower-middle and low income groups. Housing is universally recognized as one of the fundamental human needs. [...]
thesis.creator: Lau, Lai Ping.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: A study of the housing situation in Hong Kong : A social worker’s exploratory viewpoint.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Generally, the thesis relates modern technological developments in air traffic and air traffic control services to their legal regulation. It discusses the possible ways in which the liability of air tratfic control agencies could be regulated internationally. [...]
thesis.creator: Larsen, Paul B.
thesis.subject: Air & Space Law.
Liability for aircraft accidents.
Air traffic rules, International.
thesis.title: The regulation of air traffic control liability by international convention.

degree.discipline: Institute of Air and Space Law

thesis.description: The accuracy with which the pulse height can be reproduced from an electrostatic charge storage analyzer depends to a large extent on the shape of the incoming pulse. The optimum pulse has a flat top of 200 ns and short rise and fall times. This thesis presents the development of an instrument for shaping pulses from a scintillation detecter so that they are acceptable to the charge storage system. [...]
thesis.creator: Kuchela, Davudavadi S.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Pulse pre-treatment for a fast storage system.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Mystical books of ancient India written three thousand years ago describe an innate spiritual power asleep, in the shape of a coiled serpent or kundalini, at the base of the spinal column. Aroused by some sacred formula, the kundalini raises her head and ascends through a series of seven "centers" or "lotuses" representing the seats of the elements of the body. [...]
thesis.creator: Kraulis, Ilze.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Hydroxylation of adrenal corticosteroids by rat and frog adrenal tissue in vitro.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A scintillator-photodiode unit is proposed as a particle detector. Configurations employing NaI(T1) and CsI(T1) as scintillators, and photodiodes manufactured by RCA Victor and Simtec are tested using a monochramatic beam of 100 MeV protons from the McGill Synchrocyclotron. The tests are conducted with the diodes at room temperature and cooled to dry ice temperature (-56.2°C). The best combination is found to be the cooled Simtec with a CsI(T1) crystal, having a resolution of 1%. [...]
thesis.creator: Kozlow, Edward John.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: A scintillator-photodiode unit as a particle detector.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Five new isomers have been observed in a pulsed 100 MeV proton beam survey of eleven elements. Four of these isomers were examined in detail. [...]
thesis.creator: Kovács, Rezsö Lázló.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Nuclear isomerism in the millisecond range.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The phenomenon and mechanism of tissue and renal homograft rejection is reviewed. Clinical manifestation of the rejection crisis in human renal homotransplantation is described, and problems of accurate diagnosis delineated. A study of daily stained urinary sediment on transplanted patients at the Royal Victoria Hospital showed significant lymphocyturia occurring in 5 out of 5 major rejection crises studied. [...]
thesis.creator: Koo, Chia G.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: Renal homograft rejection (with special reference to urinary enzymes and lymphocyturia).
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The geostrophic kinetic energy 30N to 8ON at 1000 mb, 500 mb, 100 mb and 25 mb is computed on a daily basis for January, 1959, employing Fourier analysis. The general characteristics of the energy spectra are presented as means for the month. The daily variations reveal that tropospheric "shore" wave kinetic energy is a good indicator of surface cyclonic activity, and that the effect of tropospheric synoptic scale disturbances is strongly damped in the lower stratosphere. Four levels proved inadequate to define the vertical structure of the ultra-long waves. [...]
thesis.creator: Klump, Leo John.
thesis.subject: Meteorology.
thesis.title: Daily variations of atmospheric kinetic energy at 1000, 500, 100 and 25mb, January 1959.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Alfred de Vigny, né en 1797 et mort en 1863, a vécu et écrit en plein courant romantique. De certains côtés, son art et sa pensée portent les marques de l'école romantique; de certains autres, son oeuvre et son éthique s'en écartent. [...]
thesis.creator: Kitchin, Anne E.
thesis.subject: French.
thesis.title: La poétique d’Alfred de Vigny.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

degree.name: Master of Arts
degree.discipline: Department of French Language and Literature

thesis.description: A new method is described for the measurement of proton total reaction cross sections. The method, using two Faraday cups, permits rapid measurement of cross sections with an absolute precision of - 2.5%. In order to study the variation of cross section with mass number, the total reaction cross sections of 39 elements were measured for an incident proton energy of 100.2 MeV. [...]
thesis.creator: Kirkby, Peter.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Faraday cup measurements of proton cross sections.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Investigations of upper atmospheric processes are aimed at producing a realistic model of the atmosphere. Of primary importance in producing a model atmosphere is a knowledge of the rate constants of the possible reactions which can occur. Equally important is the effect of transport phenomena in determining the variation with altitude of many of the transient species. A knowledge of the transport properties of such species is also of considerable importance in other scientific areas such as in combustion. [...]
thesis.creator: Khouw, Boen Heng.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Some measurements of atomic hydrogen diffusion coefficients.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Neuroinhibitory characteristics have been ascribed to a number of substances in the central nervous system (McLennan, 1959; McGeer, McGeer and Mclennan, 1961). However, there is strong evidence that all the activity of extracts or Factor 1 from the mammalian central nervous system, which block the sensory discharge of crazy fish receptor preparation (Florey, 1954, 1956; Florey and Mclennan, 1955, 1959), can be totally accounted for by gamma-aminobutyric acid (Bazemore, Elliott and Florey, 1956, 1957; Levin, Lovell and Elliott, 1961; Lovell and Elliott, 1963). [...]
thesis.creator: Khan, Rashid T.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Binding and release of amino acids in brain.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: For many years, coronary artery disease has been poorly understood. The literature is full of contradictions with regard to cause and effect and there has been no agreement concerning any form of treatment, whether it be medical or surgical (Vineberg, 1964). [...]
thesis.creator: Kato, Yutaka.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: Development of the triple ameroid coronary artery occulusion test - a 100% lethal test. Value of epicardiectomy, omental graft and/or internal mammary artery implant operation in preventing death of the animal and myocardium.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The limbic system has long been thought of as an important regulator of behavioral and physiological homeostasis. Its role in motivation and emotion has held particular interest for investigators (MacLean, 1958: Mason & Brady, 1964; Papez, 1937; Stellar, 1960). More recently, its role in somatomotor function has received attention (Delgado, 1964: Gerbrandt, in press; Kaada, 1951). [...]
thesis.creator: Kasper, Phyllis Mariana.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: On the role of the rat septal area in inhibition.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Experimental and theoretical studies of the response of steels to high strain rates were performed. The study was initiated by the increase in the structural performance of gun launched vehicles of heat treated SAE 4340 steel above that predicted. A test technique was developed to simulate gun launch loadings, that permitted monitoring of the load on test specimen throughout the load cycle. Tests were carried out on SAE 4340 steel heat treated to various hardnesses. [...]
thesis.creator: Kardos, Geza.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: A study of plastic flow in steel at high rates of strain.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The design, construction and operation of a syphon tunnel meant for studies of water flow around control gates (with and without air addition) have been described. The control gates studied are of the type commonly known as 'vertical leaf gates' as shown in Figure 3.a. [...]
thesis.creator: Kapur, Arjun Dev.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: A syphon tunnel for studies of control gates.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A general survey of the literature on the mode of action, physico-chemical and toxicological properties of the halogenated hydrocarbons with special reference to the chloromethanes are presented below. [...]
thesis.creator: Kanics, Lewis.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Metabolism of the chloromethanes.

thesis.description: It is a challenge to research that although over 40 years have passed since the discovery of insulin, much disagreement still exists about the site and mechanism of action of this important hormone. The prevailing theory of action of insulin on carbohydrate metabolism is that this hormone aids the transport of glucose across the cell membrane of insulin-responsive tissues, a barrier which the sugar could not easily traverse in the absence of insulin (1). [...]
thesis.creator: Kahlenberg, Arthur.
thesis.subject: Investigative Medicine.
thesis.title: The effect of insulin and diabetes on glucose metabolism in isolated human tissues.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A theoretical and experimental investigation has been carried out to study the effect of curvature of the cowling lip on the expansion in a plug nozzle at the Mach number 1.50. In the theoretical phase of this investigation, the design of the profile of plug nozzle is based on expansion waves emanating from a cowling lip surface of variable radius of curvature, applying graphical and finite difference methods. [...]
thesis.creator: Jyoti, Vijay Kumar.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: Effects of cowling lips on the performance of two-dimensional supersonic plug nozzles.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A microscopic model is presented which describes in some detail a possible mechanism for vortex states enclosing trapped flux in simply connected superconductors. The energy associated with such states is calculated by using a formalism similar to the Bardeen - Cooper - Schrieffer formalism but using cylindrical rather than plane waves as the basis. [...]
thesis.creator: Jog, Shridhar Dattatraya.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Two problems in superconductivity.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of this study is to explore the possibility of developing a legal order in space through the technique of an international organization. The motivation for this study springs from the words of the United Nations General Assembly in that body's desire "to avoid the extension of present national rivalries into this new field" which holds the promise of unique benefits for all mankind. In this sense, it is a study of the strategy of interdependence in the space age. [...]
thesis.creator: Jasentuliyana, Nadasiri
thesis.subject: Air & Space Law.
thesis.title: Role of international organizations the development of a legal order in space.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: From the mid-nineteenth century until 1952, education in Nigeria was largely the responsibility of religious denominations. But in 1952 the control of education passed to Regional Governments who then began to participate on a large-scale in educational matters. The Western Nigeria Government led the way with a Universal Free Primary Education scheme launched in January, 1955. [...]
thesis.creator: Iziren, Omokhagbo.
thesis.subject: Education and state -- Nigeria, Western.
Education -- Nigeria, Western.
Education.
thesis.title: Problems and needs of educational administration in Western Nigeria.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Combined free and forced convection inside inclined circular tubes is studied theoretically. The case considered is that of fully developed laminar flow under constant heat flux. All fluid properties are considered constant except the density. Velocity and temperature equations are developed by perturbation analysis in terms of power series of Rayleigh number. Solutions have been obtained up to second order in Rayleigh number. When density is considered variable only in the buoyancy terms the resulting equations contain dimensionless parameters; Rayleigh, Reynolds and Prandtl numbers. [...]
thesis.creator: Iqbal, Muhammad.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: Influence of tube orientation in laminar convective heat transfer.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In holometabolic insects development proceeds through several larvaland a pupal instar.(l) The larva differentiates into the adult via the pupa. The transition from the fully grown larva to the adult organism is called matamorphosis. The change from each instar to the next involves moulting, during which the old chitinous exoskeleton is shed and a new one formed. [...]
thesis.creator: Ilan, Joseph.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Metabolism of protein and nucleic acids during the metamorphosis of Tenebrio Molitor L.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Quebec was the first province in Canada to establish a ministry of education. It did so in 1867. The experiment was short-lived. The present study is an attempt to account for that experiment in government and administration, to describe its scope and function, and finally to understand how and why it was terminated in 1875. [...]
thesis.creator: Hunte, Keith Donnerson.
thesis.subject: History.
Québec (Province). Ministère de l’éducation -- History.
thesis.title: The Ministry of Public Instruction in Quebec, 1867-1875.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
